title: How to Cook Austrian Chocolate and Walnut Tart

steps.headline: Beware any hands!
steps.description: Since tart dough must be cold, like the ingredients, keep your warm hands out of the mixture.

steps.headline: Mix the flour, sugar and cocoa powder.
Mix the ingredients until that you get a sandy texture composition.
steps.description: Do not mix a lot, just enough to heat the butter. Beat the egg with a little salt and add it to the flour mixture.

steps.headline: Mix until you get a dough with a smooth composition.
steps.description: The resulting dough should be refrigerated in a Saran wrap, for at least one hour.

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F).
steps.description: Remove the dough from the refrigerator. Line a pie form/pan with parchment or similar baking paper. Shape the dough into the pan/form, pressing down lightly and quickly.

steps.headline: Prick the dough with a fork to allow air to circulate.
steps.description: Pre-bake the dough for 20 minutes. After 20 minutes, take it out and grease it with a beaten egg white. Set aside in readiness for adding the filling shortly.

steps.headline: Shave the chocolate with a knife.
steps.description: Place the shavings into a deep bowl.

steps.headline: In a pot over medium heat, evenly add milk, butter and whipped cream.
steps.description: Stir continuously until the first boil.

steps.headline: Pour this mixture over the shaved chocolate.
steps.description: Stir gently using a wooden spoon, being careful not to make foam or bubbles. Do not use an electric mixer, as it will create foam.

steps.headline: Beat the two eggs in a bowl.
steps.description: Fold them into the chocolate cream mix. Mix until you obtain a liquid composition that is slightly creamy.

steps.headline: Add walnuts onto the semi-baked tart base greased with egg white.
steps.description: Pour the chocolate cream mixture over the top.

steps.headline: Place the pan in the oven.
steps.description: Bake for 10 minutes at 180ºC/350ºF. Turn of the fire or the heat and leave the tart to bake in the remaining warmth of the oven for another 10 minutes.

steps.headline: Remove from the oven when baked.
steps.description: Let it cool, then put it in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour before serving.

text: Preparing the pâte sablée (pastry base) Beware any hands! Since tart dough must be cold, like the ingredients, keep your warm hands out of the mixture. Mix the flour, sugar and cocoa powder. Add butter, cut into cubes. Mix the ingredients until that you get a sandy texture composition. Do not mix a lot, just enough to heat the butter. Beat the egg with a little salt and add it to the flour mixture. Mix until you get a dough with a smooth composition. The resulting dough should be refrigerated in a Saran wrap, for at least one hour. Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F). Remove the dough from the refrigerator. Line a pie form/pan with parchment or similar baking paper. Shape the dough into the pan/form, pressing down lightly and quickly. Prick the dough with a fork to allow air to circulate. Pre-bake the dough for 20 minutes. After 20 minutes, take it out and grease it with a beaten egg white. Set aside in readiness for adding the filling shortly. Making the filling Shave the chocolate with a knife. Place the shavings into a deep bowl. In a pot over medium heat, evenly add milk, butter and whipped cream. Stir continuously until the first boil. Pour this mixture over the shaved chocolate. Stir gently using a wooden spoon, being careful not to make foam or bubbles. Do not use an electric mixer, as it will create foam. Beat the two eggs in a bowl. Fold them into the chocolate cream mix. Mix until you obtain a liquid composition that is slightly creamy. Add walnuts onto the semi-baked tart base greased with egg white. Pour the chocolate cream mixture over the top. Place the pan in the oven. Bake for 10 minutes at 180ºC/350ºF. Turn of the fire or the heat and leave the tart to bake in the remaining warmth of the oven for another 10 minutes. Remove from the oven when baked. Let it cool, then put it in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour before serving. Finished.
